intro: Mitrasacme inornata, commonly known as the slender mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It has small, elliptical leaves that are usually covered in a fine, white pubescence. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, fleshy berries. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
